channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: My grandfather co-signed my cousin‚Äôs student loan. After my grandfather died, my cousin skipped town. Will the estate have to pay the debt?
item.description: ‚ÄúThe loan is now in default, and I have no idea where this grandson is.‚Äù

item.title: A little-known law has forced more than 120,000 veterans to return payouts they received to leave the military, new data shows
item.description: A federal law forced thousands of disabled veterans over the years to return the sizeable payouts they received to leave the military.

item.title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway sold nearly half its stake in Apple
item.description: Berkshire disclosed an $84.2 billion stake in Apple at the end of the second quarter, suggesting that Buffett offloaded more than 49% of the tech stake.

item.title: Medicare patients could get emergency treatment at home under new bill
item.description: A new proposal in Congress would allow older Medicare recipients to receive emergency medical services at home rather than having to be transported to a hospital for care, which could help them avert potential health and financial consequences resulting from a hospital visit.

item.title: Harris campaign says Trump is 'running scared' after he offers Fox debate
item.description: Donald Trump previously said he was willing to debate Kamala Harris multiple times.

item.title: Warren Buffett raises Berkshire cash level to record $277 billion after slashing stock holdings
item.description: Berkshire Hathaway's cash pile swelled to a record $276.9 billion as Warren Buffett continued dumping his one-time favorite Apple stake.

item.title: How to try and grow $2,000

item.title: You‚Äôll know AI has taken over when we no longer value money
item.description: A future where machines organize, decide and execute all economic activities is no future at all.

item.title: Gender identity dispute surrounding boxers Lin Yu-ting and Imane Khelif condemned by IOC president
item.description: International Olympic Committee President Thomas Bach said concerns over the gender of boxers Imane Khelif and Lin Yu-ting was "totally unacceptable."

item.title: Trump agrees to debate Harris on Fox News Sept. 4
item.description: U.S. Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump has agreed to a Fox News offer to hold a debate with Democratic U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris on Sept. 4.

item.title: Is there a blood test for Alzheimer‚Äôs? Yes, but it isn‚Äôt at your doctor‚Äôs office yet.
item.description: A blood test has greater success than doctors in determining whether someone has memory loss due to Alzheimer‚Äôs disease, a new study found.

item.title: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin withdraws plea deal for accused 9/11 terrorists
item.description: The deal had been announced on Wednesday.

item.title: Dow closes down 600 points, Nasdaq enters correction after weak jobs report: Live updates
item.description: Stocks slid Friday as a much weaker-than-anticipated jobs report for July ignited worries that the economy could be falling into a recession.

item.title: Market Turnaround: What‚Äôs Hot Right Now üî•
item.description: Good evening, Folks. Jeff Bishop here! I don‚Äôt know about you, but Friday sure felt like a great way for me to end the week. It was a very choppy week, and a few trades didn‚Äôt go my way, but when I saw the market start to turn the corner on Friday, I knew it [‚Ä¶]

item.title: Making billionaires pay more in taxes is only fair ‚Äî even millionaires want it
item.description: Finance ministers of the G20 nations agree that the ultra-rich should pay their fair share.

item.title: Tech stocks see steepest three-week slump in two years, led by plunge in Amazon and Intel
item.description: With quarterly earnings largely in the rearview mirror, Wall Street is troubled by what it's seeing out of Silicon Valley.

item.title: Summer Olympics viewership is up ‚Äî and Snoop Dogg is part of the buzz
item.description: Viewership for the Summer Olympics in Paris is up on NBC and Peacock, and for many, Snoop Dogg's role on the sidelines has been a draw.
